definitions.definition: To deliver (someone or something) following a judicial decision.
To devote (oneself) to a given activity, occupation, thing etc.
To bind (a person or thing) to the service of something.
To devote or pledge (oneself) to a given person, cause etc.
To devote (one's mind, talent etc.) to a given activity, occupation, thing etc.
To make (someone) become devoted to a given thing or activity; to cause to be addicted .

main_definition: ( transitive , Ancient Rome ) To deliver (someone or something) following a judicial decision. [from 16th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( reflexive , now rare , archaic ) To devote (oneself) to a given activity, occupation, thing etc. [from 16th c.]
( transitive , obsolete ) To bind (a person or thing) to the service of something. [16th–18th c.]
( reflexive , obsolete ) To devote or pledge (oneself) to a given person, cause etc. [16th–19th c.]
( transitive , now rare , archaic ) To devote (one's mind, talent etc.) to a given activity, occupation, thing etc. [from 16th c.]
( transitive ) To make (someone) become devoted to a given thing or activity; to cause to be addicted . [from 17th c.]
